name: Authentic Vietnamese Spring Rolls (Nem Ran Hay Cha Gio)
author: agoldstone
summary: This is a recipe I learned while traveling through Vietnam. The ingredients are relatively simple and easy to find in any grocery store. I've cooked this a number of times since getting back and it's always been a hit. They taste great with dipping sauce.
ingredients: ¼ cup shrimp - washed, peeled, and cut into small pieces
directions: Soak rice noodles in cold water until soft, about 20 minutes
Drain well; cut into 2-inch long pieces
Combine the noodle pieces, chicken, shrimp, eggs, carrot, wood fungus mushrooms, and green onions in a large bowl
Sprinkle in sugar, salt, and black pepper; stir filling mixture well
Soak 1 rice paper wrapper in a shallow bowl of warm water to soften, about 15 seconds
Remove from water and place on a damp cloth laid out on a flat surface
Place 1 tablespoon of filling mixture into the center of the softened rice paper
Fold the bottom edge into the center, covering the filling
Fold in opposing edges and roll up tightly
Repeat with remaining rice paper wrappers, soaking and filling each one individually
Heat oil in a work or large skillet over medium heat
Fry the spring rolls in batches of 3 or 4 until crisp and golden brown on both sides, about 5 minutes
